3FS.F.summary: Kalray S.A. provides low-power and time-critical processor solutions in France. It offers massively parallel manycore array processors. The company also provides data center solutions, including Kalray Target Controller, a family of storage solutions offering an all-in-one system to build optimized NVMe-of just a bunch of flash; and TurboBoost, a solution to offload the encryption/decryption operations involved in secure communications. In addition, it offers software development kits, such as AccessCore that allows customers to program the massively parallel processor array using standard languages comprising C/C++/OpenCL, programming models, APIs, and tools; and Kalray Neural Network, a tool for implementing deep learning networks on the massively parallel processor array, as well as other software and tools. Further, the company provides PCIe and PCIe acceleration boards for storage, networking, cryptography applications; and development platforms. It serves autonomous vehicle, aerospace/avionic, artificial intelligence, data storage, data networking, and computer vision markets. The company is headquartered in Montbonnot Saint Martin, France.

6SQB.F.summary: Sequans Communications S.A. designs, develops, and supplies cellular semiconductor solutions for massive, broadband, and critical Internet of Things (IoT) markets in Taiwan, Korea, China, rest of Asia, the United States, and internationally. It offers a set of 5G/4G chips and modules for non-smartphone devices. For 5G/4G massive IoT applications, the company provides a comprehensive product portfolio based on its flagship Monarch LTE-M/NB-IoT and Calliope Cat 1 chip platforms featuring low power consumption, a set of integrated functionalities, and deployment capability. For 5G/4G broadband and critical IoT applications, Sequans Communications S.A. offers a product portfolio based on its Cassiopeia Cat 4/Cat 6 4G and high-end Taurus 5G chip platforms optimized for residential, enterprise, and industrial applications. The company serves OEMs and ODMs Customers, as well as 4G and 5G wireless carriers. The company was incorporated in 2003 and is headquartered in Paris, France.

In addition, it offers software development kits, such as AccessCore that allows customers to program the massively parallel processor array using standard languages comprising C/C++/OpenCL, programming models, APIs, and tools; and Kalray Neural Network, a tool for implementing deep learning networks on the massively parallel processor array, as well as other software and tools. AS6A.F.summary: Paragon ID SA provides identification solutions worldwide. The company offers various terminals, including couplers, readers, and accessories; traceability and stock, radio frequency identification (RFID), security, and durable labels; and container tracking, secure application module, mobile ticketing, operational maintenance, brand protection, customer relationship management, stock management, and access control solutions. It also provides contactless smartcards, magnetic and contactless tickets, passport e-covers, identification documents, timed use tickets, dual interface smart cards, advertickets, and consumables, as well as near field communication labels, tags or stickers. In addition, the company offers secure service solutions comprising card and document personalization; and eTrust that transforms secure paper-based products into intelligent documents. It serves various clients in aviation, smart cities, pharmaceutical, mobility, health, mass transit and public transport, manufacturing, sport and leisure, parking, automotive, gaming, higher education, logistics, luxury products, agriculture/food, secure ID, and retail industries. The company is based in Mougins, France. Paragon ID SA is a subsidiary of Paragon Group Limited.
